file_content.text: Alert: this is an Imperial News Network special bulletin.
Warning: this is an Imperial News Network emergency alert.
This is an Imperial News Network travel ban alert.
This is an official reminder from the Ministry of Logistics: per Imperial Edict 1968Z, lethal force is authorized against rakghouls and rakghoul plague carriers.
There are multiple confirmed reports of the Taris rakghoul plague spreading to other inhabited systems.
Victims of rakghoul plague suffer full-body physical mutations and become highly aggressive. They pose an extreme risk of infection or death.
If you encounter evidence of a rakghoul plague outbreak, report it immediately to the nearest Imperial military station. Failure to comply is considered treason.
This has been an Imperial News Network special bulletin.
There are increasing reports of rakghoul plague outbreaks in Imperial space and bordering systems. The infection rate is growing exponentially.
For your own safety, interstellar travel has been restricted by the Ministry of Logistics.
A rakghoul plague outbreak is confirmed on the planet Tatooine. The system is now considered a Level Omega hazard to all travelers.
Imperial citizens are urged to avoid Tatooine. Do not attempt to contact anyone currently on the planet or offer aid to the native population.
Authorities will advise when the travel ban expires. Once again, all citizens are urged to avoid planet Tatooine.
Remain vigilant, keep calm, and report all suspicious activity to the nearest Imperial military post. Failure to comply is treason.
If you or anyone you know exhibits symptoms of rakghoul plague, it is your Imperial duty to eliminate the threat by any means necessary.
Do not hesitate. The Empire's security depends on you.
Officials indicate the death toll exceeds ten thousand, with many infected still at large. Anyone mutated by the rakghoul plague represents an extreme threat.
